column5: This versatile master's degree combines cognitive and clinical approaches to neuroscience. It seeks to apply neuroscientific techniques to further your understanding of the human mind and explores the underlying mechanisms associated with disease and disorders of the nervous system. You'll be equipped with an understanding of contemporary issues in cognitive and clinical neuroscience and developing your skills and ability to use neuroscientific methods in a research and clinical environment.Why study the Cognitive and Clinical Neuroscience at Middlesex UniversityThis course focuses on the advanced study of neuroscience, with a focus on understanding the brain in both health and disease.
